title: OSAL Wrapper for Linux on R-Car V3H/V3M/V4H/V4M/S4

description: This document describes updates and restrictions for this release.
This document describes the contents regarding to the OSAL Wrapper for Linux on R-Car V3H/V3M/V4H/V4M/S4. \n

table.name:
R-Car V3H Ver1.1, V3H_2 Ver2.1

 R-Car S4(includes S4N)
table.note: The quality grade of R-Car V3H Ver1.1, V4H Ver2.0,2.1 are always Reference. \n

 - Yocto Recipe Package v6.20.0

section.name: Version 3.5.0
description: - Separated OS-dependent processing part and OS-independent processing part \n
Along with the above changes, the structure of the User's Manual has changed.
This is the return value originally described in the API specification.
- Added following restriction, Table 1-3 has more details.
- Added a Fixed issue, Table 4-1 has more details.
- Resolved following known issues, Table 4-1 has more details.

section.name: Version 3.6.0
description: - Update API status from Partially Support to Fully support in Table 2-1
- The file structure of osal_configuration has been changed as follows. \n
- Resolved following restriction, Table 4-1 has more details.
- Added Fixed issues, Table 4-1 has more details.

section.name: Version 3.7.0
description: - Added Fixed issues, Table 4-1 has more details.

section.name: Version 3.8.0
description: - Changed the behavior when OSAL_MEMORY_MANAGER_CFG_UNLIMITED is specified to p_config->max_allowed_allocations and p_config->max_registered_monitors_cbs of the argument of R_OSAL_MmngrOpen.
- Before: OSAL_MEMORY_MANAGER_CFG_UNLIMITED could be specified as an argument but OSAL_RETURN_MEM was returned due to lack of space when allocating memory. \n
- After: When OSAL_MEMORY_MANAGER_CFG_UNLIMITED is specified as an argument, it operates with the maximum value defined in g_osal_memory_max_configration. \n
- Note: If there is not a memory area that can allocate the maximum value of the internal configuration, R_OSAL_MmngrOpen returns OSAL_RETURN_MEM the same as previously.

section.name: Version 3.9.0
description: - Added Fixed issues, Table 4-1 has more details.
- Added a known issue, Table 3-1 has more details.

section.name: Version 3.10.0
description: - Updated R_OSAL_IoDeviceOpen() to allow multiple processes to open the same device ID
- Added Fixed issues, Table 4-1 has more details.

section.name: Version 3.11.0
description: - Set CPU affinity so that target thread run on the specified CPU cores.
- Added CPU affinity value and corespond thread to OSAL Configuration.
- Removed restriction (ASDRCXPOSAL-456) in Table 2-1 API Status List.  \n
This restriction was moved to "1.3. Restrictions" in API User's Manual.
- Added Fixed issues, Table 4-1 has more details.

section.name: Version 3.12.0
description: - Supported R-Car V3H1.1 and R-Car S4N
- Added Fixed issues, Table 4-1 has more details.

section.name: Version 3.13.0
description: - Updated module version of OSAL Wrapper to support R-Car V4H2.2 and V4M1.0

section.name: Version 3.15.0
description: - Added new memory region to osal_configuration that is located in a 40-bit address space.
- Added the following error cause explanation in the Wrapper User's Manual.

table.description: [Ver 3.1.0] Resolved an issue that caiplite_wrapper_00 could not be opened even though it was defined in the device tree.

[Ver 3.1.0] The Restriction "Return OSAL_RETURN_FAIL from R_OSAL_PmSetRequiredState when control clock about system_ram_00." was confirmed as the expected behavior according to the specifications of the SoC.
[Ver 3.2.0] Kernel no longer outputs warning, when Device Open/Close system_ram_00.

description: [Ver 3.2.0] The following APIs correctly return states even for devices that have not been assigned Reset. (Previously, OSAL returned OSAL_RETURN_FAIL.) \n
The following APIs now return OSAL_RETURN_UNSUPPORTED_OPERATION for devices that have not been assigned Reset. (Previously OSAL returned OSAL_RETURN_FAIL.) \n
[Ver 3.2.0] SoC: R-Car V4H \n Fixed an error in the kernel when using R_OSAL_PmSetPostClock().
[Ver 3.2.0] SoC: R-Car V3H2.1/V3M2.0 \n Fixed an error in the kernel when using R_OSAL_PmSetPostClock().
[Ver 3.3.0] Fixed axi id and axi bus name string returned by the following API. \n
[Ver 3.5.0] Fixed the problem that there was a possibility of accessing outside the memory area when accessing the device. \n
[Ver 3.5.0] In case of specified handle->p_ptr_self is NULL, the return value is now returned according to API specification. \n
[Ver 3.5.0] In case of specified regionIdx which is out-of-range, the return value is now returned according to API specification. \n
\n[Ver 3.5.0] Fixed wrong size when allocating memory for strings by internal function \n
[Ver 3.6.0] Corrected parameter check of R_OSAL_MmngrGetOsalMaxConfig as following. \n
- region_idx: Deleted because it was redundantly checked \n
- range: Fixed to return OSAL_RETURN_CONF error instead of memory_limit=0 when g_osal_memory_region_info_list.p_info[region_idx].range is more than MEMORY_RESERVE_SIZE
[Ver 3.7.0] Resolved the problem of memory corruption when the ipmmu-id obtained from UIO is invalid \n
[Ver 3.7.0] Fixed the return value in case of OSAL_AXI_BUS_ID_INVALID is specified to the argument axi_id of R_OSAL_MmngrGetHwAddr. \n
axi_id should be specified a value other than OSAL_AXI_BUS_ID_INVALID.
[Ver 3.7.0] Fixed the issue that a segmentation fault occurred when specified an out-of-range value to the argument of R_OSAL_IoGetAxiBusName.
[Ver 3.9.0] Fixed the issue that if a device_name_1 halfway equals a device_name_2, R_OSAL_IoDeviceOpen() returned OSAL_RETURN_BUSY error. \n
[Ver 3.9.0] Fixed incorrect return value for error case when following API is called without wait time. \n
[Ver 3.10.0] Fixed Power Manager API incorrect return value when specifying a device with no assigned POWER/CLK. \n
[Ver 3.10.0] The initial power policy is determined only at initialization.  \n
It remains unchanged when the device is opened/closed.
[Ver 3.11.0] Fixed incorrect return value when a device name with more characters than OSAL_DEVICE_TYPE_NAME_MAX_LENGTH
is specified for the first argument "p_device_type_name" of R_OSAL_IoGetDeviceList(). \n
[Ver 3.12.0] Fixed behavior when calling R_OSAL_PmWaitForState(state = OSAL_PM_STATE_RESET) for a device that has only reset assigned. \n
[Ver 3.13.0] Device tree of R-Car V4M has been supported the Multi-memory-region function in the osal_memory_sample_v4m.
[Ver 3.13.0] Linux BSP of R-Car V4M has been supported the device access in the osal_sample_device_v4m.
